9ED3E238499647C6926BD11A21736775.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

72B83F4F2FA64993B1C493A5D821F75B.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

B005C626823E4942B021B0592537BF52.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

592E711BE71741C499970686442BED7F.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

1AD08B6D6247498A8A97EA3C9DC4173F.description: Showcase skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

2D6057654DAC46E7B05C1E1665982B5B.description: Relate work placement experience to personal and career goals.

63772E45961644DE8689D10425DED42D.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement

C95740D0241C4306B36FD67BE11AC47B.description: Document personal experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, • skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance employability.

6263B2D6CF284794B4077765003BB09C.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

13C67675873F4D5CAEDF75EC94B6F802.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

01E45A1419EA45C986EA8472EFD4409C.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

356FA3A534FE41B9814CA01A53FC01BB.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

F2362626A4694FBD9BC1005DCF0CC13C.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

3D34F2E9C4674AE6A7FABE5D56B09BC6.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear? , When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance? ,What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

BDC8F6005B58470793D84B3040596672.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

D5E9DDBEB0734D1EAFBDAEEA1BDDDD15.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: • transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

E558D1E1467745C088599B4695CB35BD.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

2AFC021905E9463D8D1C26E83F2217B0.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

A027CAF64FD44DB782F732143D23041C.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

9736CA1BAB6742FB87D53C397C14D289.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

FDC52B6CC7EA4373A06F5B797A5439FE.description: Develop a proposal to resolve the chosen local environmental design improvement opportunity.

182F8BB9C7834AFC9DD1E3ED03808187.description: Generate free-hand and digital sketches illustrating environmental design improvements

A3A276A401F94EA6BD2AAF2F636C7DE8.description: Propose environmental design improvement options for the chosen design scenario.

7517965A57B74084A0B76940AFD92DCF.description: Access local expertise regarding options that may be possible to improve the chosen environmental design scenario.

A02FFA5EB3E54F2B93D8B3C13BD090D0.description: Collaborate with a partner to propose possible environmental design solutions for a chosen scenario.

F14CCCDC57DB4A66B66E7443932ECB85.description: Create a narrative describing a local environmental design improvement opportunity.

70E7AC6C0C284A9A82F951FEC05CF37B.description: Describe opportunities in the local environment (e.g., home, school, community centre, place of worship, recreational complex) to improve interactive user experiences or address deficiencies that may be resolved through changes in design.

30DC1B7F7C914A769282F8DC6811D1E1.description: Apply the design process to address a local environmental design problem.

A4869167053142BFAB768E2BE53997E1.description: Develop a strategy for attaining a job or starting a business of personal interest in the design field.

2AE562206B44429D9E8130B361FFA81C.description: Analyze personal suitability for a specific design-related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; entrepreneurial disposition; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wage rates in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental, and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; professional and business licensing requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends impacting the occupation

37E1527F94114A92B7DE65F7AEA06FC9.description: Network with others to identify occupations related to design.

766E08363B3E4A2C858C4F9271CD32CA.description: Identify which design related occupations are facing personnel shortages and which are oversupplied on a local, regional and national scale

E25BA957403A4001941C75CDD8EAEA12.description: Contemplate the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in design related careers.

D8FF28D458784B6EB30BE23D7FCBBC22.description: Research business opportunities and job prospects in a design career of interest.

AC182A5768404C77ABB0E411CC5E7563.description: Discover prerequisites for some of the post-secondary training and career opportunities that exist in the design field.

BCE154FB4E654A7AAA72D6DADFD36297.description: Investigate institutions that offer relevant programs for design-based careers in Saskatchewan and Canada

F8917BE827FF476EBCADC780DE1F1189.description: Identify industries, businesses and careers that utilize design.

08BBE25DDDAB447193C3328A6813471C.description: Analyze design related business opportunities and occupations in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

48147DDD4C604E8EB42EFAAA7729013B.description: The Business and Profession of Design (Core)

97E097CC5493493EAF3359D19C8EE00D.description: Evaluate the impact of the product on society in terms of: cost; access; interpersonal relationships; consumer support; and,  longevity (e.g., timed obsolescence).

86DCF0154EFA444395384BF31EE20691.description: Assess the impact of form and function on the product.

6063A9E74BA947EAB7B9950DDE412C24.description: Describe how ergonomics have been considered in design of a chosen product (e.g., How does the design promote reduction of strain or improved efficiency?).

627798EA38C74F878BDAAFED5941CB20.description: Investigate how environment influences design of a product (e.g., Where is the product going to be used? What materials are available to produce the product?).

362DCEC3B4E5413388024EB91C495C22.description: Explore how human, environmental and ergonomic factors impact design solutions.

D3C9884261524380A408D67688B55C0E.description: Critique the functionality and purpose to contemporary environmental design applications.

097305BF385A40D9931661AB1BD8DA41.description: Examine the design process and how it applies to environmental design

E39D3F6FA25445EDA5FFC989DFD534A7.description: Investigate local, provincial and national environmental requirements and apply to a design plan (e.g., community regulations about building materials, colour, landscape options, access to easements).

0470A2398D66429EBCE01A34490EBCBB.description: Create a plan for a landscape design, architectural design, interior design, or an urban development design incorporating environmental design considerations.

589AE5C3757F41EE85E01973215902D2.description: Describe the application of universal design to environmental design.

D91B0DB803854FDA9B4F7E32199FAA8E.description: Examine creativity and innovation and their relationship to environmental design.

0D77A0A5242945ECB9BA2DE55DC65326.description: Discuss the importance of environmental design in relation to human wellbeing.

EF7097F8808346C5AB476B49180DB514.description: Define environmental design and its various applications (e.g., building architecture, landscape architecture, interior design, regional and urban planning).

FEBDA923EC8A4E1BB86D0D4BF44801F1.description: Assess the importance of environmental design to human well-being.

87C993DE6EC44E93994955DE79D7E95B.description: Compile a list of products that could have the lifecycle extended in the local community.

2B55CCE508C94E0B8F9832079F9EBEF3.description: Create an extended life product using one or more of the following techniques (e.g., repair, repurpose, redesign, recycle).

A43F79180B3346CC83C3D184A5373C40.description: Examine the environmental impact of the development of intermediate materials.

5DA40006F01E472BA9FD87DC27773271.description: Determine how intermediate materials (e.g., silicone chips, batteries, plastic, glass, alloys) are produced from raw materials (e.g., ores, sands lithium).

7D6AC633651C4A7DAF589D74D25D090A.description: Examine alternate material choices in a design to increase sustainability.

FAB01619092C499B881BDA3819E9F342.description: Investigate environmental impacts of materials and production methods used in design.

D2F39C7228AF48649EC6758CBABC0FA8.description: Identify ways a product lifecycle can be extended (e.g., repair, repurpose, redesign, recycle).

6214AD4F0057442D941D0256DBA85231.description: Simulate making informed, responsible consumer decisions related to environmental design.

E5453C850A9C4A2384435F56FDC58C26.description: Examine the importance of green space as a healing space.

ECA9154ABFBC41F4AC411BFFC90709E1.description: Explore the importance of gender balance when designing space.

2B31DCE6B8D0415F8C086F901C86514C.description: Assess how First Nation architects and landscape designers use shape and space to reflect traditional ways of knowing.

C8B4C16A29FC48A79EF15BCA1893C0E2.description: Explore the idea of architectural design as blending in or highlight the natural world instead of acting as a monument on top of it.

F54D1277049D4F7EA514792D8C09698D.description: Analyze how various types of design are influenced by elements of First Nations and Métis ways of knowing, including: • the four directions (north, south, east, west); traditional colours; designing to include the natural environment; using natural patterns such as solar movement to increase efficiency; the role and expression of spirituality and connection between heavens and earth in design; use of rock as a building material to ground to the earth; and, the significance of clockwise movement in the design of space.

64B0BE94D5E24F149AFEC6928E4424B7.description: Investigate the influence of First Nations and Métis traditions, histories and ways of knowing on various types of design (e.g., environ-mental design, graphic design, interior design).

65293E4FFC2A4E91A6B15A217B92BCAC.description: Explore how design reflects First Nations and Métis tradition and history in Canada.

7D42FA33344F4539A7F947D609DFC4C3.description: Analyze how elements of First Nations and Métis ways of knowing influence design decisions.

D34B2A1C429A45F790C21538ABFE1772.description: First Nations and Métis Ways of Knowing in Design (Core)

5CDAFA0954474294B847A76BF5A34E3C.description: Reflect on the process of imagining solutions to design problems documented in a journal or portfolio.

B1EFE8ACF8384658984C5240B38B05F9.description: Develop a design proposal for a product or system modification that will solve the given challenge.

E175CD6F0BC442569BD776D5A96C2D63.description: Develop a proposal for a design modification to resolve a given social issue or need utilizing the principles and elements of design.

3FCCC52EB1D745C98E96DAF7B7BE7F24.description: Brainstorm a list of social issues to which a design solution may be possible.

860CAAAF0948497C9F7170B60E18BF84.description: Speculate how the design of products, processes and places can limit access based on factors such as race, gender, sexual orientation, age, socio-economic status, mental health and physical well-being.

CEBCC7298AD2447DA8B94AD698E99457.description: Predict how factors such as race, gender, age, socio- economic status, mental health and physical abilities can influence the design process.

1DA34C77337145C2834835FAB5A9CC8A.description: Explore design expectations that occur in society.

F69B58152DC548FA81C564A5504BA933.description: Analyze a current social issue or need using the design process.

BDB183FA93CD4508BA6C1BAEDE1B8218.description: Explain the relationship between form and function in the design solution.

63D15CF08EED4A69B1D6E831E3366FBB.description: Consider alternative materials and processes that might be used for a product to improve its quality and unit cost of production.

D42F85DC534343F384CA5640D6F3698C.description: Describe the stages of production necessary to produce a product in industry.

EB302B2E0D9840E5B47BE85F910696AA.description: Identify various materials and fabrication processes to be considered in resolving a two-dimensional design problem or challenge.

B373E04F12524988B016CBFE1B0CBD7F.description: Identify a two-dimensional design problem or challenge to be resolved (e.g., cost of production per unit is too high, consumers are not purchasing the volume expected).

05103578594942D39FBD11F5CD675D97.description: Articulate a design process as it relates to two-dimensional projects.

8D52B5FDCA2947EBB10A0038F3B07365.description: Design solutions to a given twodimensional design problem.

CF904F97E61F42DE83CF38C338A18033.description: Identify contexts in which free hand sketching is most appropriate and those in which digital sketching is most appropriate.

B0A1DA63EED74454B5697C9BBE5AB1F0.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of freehand drawings of design sketches and design sketches using digital tools.

D5E9E9D113B24137A07C6201EE90F293.description: Sketch pictorial drawings using digital tools, demonstrating: layout; proportion; accuracy; and, neatness.

4636F842543C458AA7C153BE44D7FC5D.description: Sketch isometric drawings (30o and 60o ) using digital tools, demonstrating: layout; proportion; accuracy; and, neatness.

28CA9A8801B34A499122764521D37414.description: Sketch orthographic drawings using digital tools, demonstrating: layout; proportion; accuracy; and, neatness.

35507AC702B1443F8770A98155581136.description: Sketch simple two-dimensional geometric figures and shapes using digital tools, demonstrating aspects including: ; layout; proportion; accuracy; and, neatness.

91B9A30B8AA44E498F7F92BDF7E46D51.description: Articulate the differences between drawings of various geometric forms such as two-dimensional geometric figures, orthographic form, or pictorial form.

BF34685F621D4FCBAD3E26EDAA6371B5.description: Identify drawings of various geometric forms such as two-dimensional geometric figures, orthographic form or pictorial form.

FD2F6390965C46B3A672B7A3F5C52F6F.description: Create a sketch and shade of a manufactured form using digital tools such as digital software, digital stylus, and photo manipulation software.

4324B1C7FD6B4E2FBB41C98706550133.description: Create a sketch and shade of a natural form using digital tools such as design software, digital stylus and photo manipulation software.

A6DA394C8ACC46878019D64E23AAB6DE.description: Create sketches demonstrating layout and proportion using digital tools to illustrate ideas and support design processes.

0E0B371F2AE34B698D3B98E0850F483E.description: Provide examples to prove the following statement: All prototypes are models, but not all models are prototypes.

2F0548A5288A42B994B984A15C291040.description: Create a variety of models that illustrate the various reasons scale models are used in the design process.

D4D4EA15E4A5476FA60D917334BD87E0.description: Investigate how various materials are utilized to achieve a structural foundation for three dimensional models.

6FCAD129364947C18CDF04E7347C9D20.description: Assess strength characteristics of materials to support a threedimensional model.

B86E249DB57B4A6F81525734D6E0504E.description: Create experiments to determine how materials are used in model making and how to effectively connect pieces to each other.

72D5296D9E244A82A81DDAF8A3BC7877.description: Identify different forms of connectors and adhesives used in model making.

FB7D75629CFE4515BE014E837B0DADF9.description: Explore the different properties of various materials available to produce a model.

B2AE866C0AEA46A3B3CF5F34811E8CF8.description: Demonstrate the use of scale measurements that correlate to a model.

362A47A011C040928A9506576D769C57.description: Construct threedimensional scale models using a variety of materials.

0F8FBBE2771D4087B99307D822E06FF3.description: Consider how cultural contexts and universal design considerations may influence an initial design or solutions to design challenges.

59B467D469D7445C9B3609778EEF4F87.description: Create a brief or proposal to demonstrate solving a manufacturing design challenge or problem.

13EFE593512849E1AD77420894553B38.description: Propose a solution to a given manufacturing design challenge or problem, including: consideration of materials used; intended use for the product; and, the environment in which it is intended to be used.

DB61B80CA9EA4F7C86C3AABF417EBD21.description: Consider another manufacturing process and redesign a product to work within that process, including description of: • how the design changes to suit the new process; • new limitations which arise with the changing process; and, • assessment to determine if the final redesigned product yields improvement

0C0DE93678964FCA91ECC221C28ED20C.description: Utilize design systems to duplicate a design

9001877C96E643C4AEC9AECC85D2AEC1.description: Identify available manufacturing components, including: expertise; accessibility of machinery; location; and, costs.

8291C8869A6D43B1B099F6F994B27B87.description: Investigate availability of various manufacturing processes and identify strengths and limitations of the processes available.

B7BBCDDEF8084677A3EC4F7290FD7741.description: Identify approaches for gathering data (e.g., customer satisfaction surveys, number of products returned to manufacturer as defective or broken prior to their anticipated lifespan, design variations on a similar product from other designers or manufacturers) about the satisfaction level of consumers interacting with the design of a product.

70ECB620CABB41AC8A3211F37BE91CD7.description: Explore problem solving processes in manufacturing systems.

6F50816D23B14328993E637478614A2E.description: Refine the design, incorporating information gathered from feedback.

A8A979FBFB324183A6F0DEE16FE4FF62.description: Elicit critique from peers, industry experts and/or community members using appropriate terminology from the design process.

A3CFE737FC6542BD84AFDF627FA9CC64.description: Apply the creative design process to a given situation or need, such as the creation of: an advertising campaign using visual media; a book cover for a novel; a cover for a music album; a poster advertising a film; or, a brand or product logo.

D9DAEE48F95A41C6823D16414A09634B.description: Examine different situations that may require steps in a design process to be repeated or revisited

26A340AD667A42AE832DF500DB0E4412.description: Describe the creative design process, including the difference between art and design.

6C098CD8CB8D4AA094F8E9E6962926E5.description: Implement the creative design process for a given scenario.

F3E592B69E34462EA1E0792D69695C25.description: Implementation of the Creative Design Process (Core)
